definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
erhua variant of 人情味[ren2 qing2 wei4]

sentences.english: Aside from the bargains, flea markets always have a great atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 除了捡便宜，逛跳蚤市场最有趣的是感受人情味。

sentences.english: We should show empathy when we deal with problems.
sentences.chinese: 我们处理问题也要有些人情味儿。

sentences.english: exemplify, as a body, the professional and humane behavior of its members;
sentences.chinese: 作为主体，例证其成员专业且有人情味的行为。

sentences.english: Once we started drinking, the conversation at our table became much less impersonal.
sentences.chinese: 我们一喝起酒来，桌边的交谈就变得失去了人情味了。

sentences.english: It is the heart of the image to borrow things performance appeal.
sentences.chinese: 它是心借物的形象来显示情味。

sentences.english: Give yourself permission to be human.
sentences.chinese: 允许自己富于“人情味儿”。

sentences.english: Don't say that I have no sentiment!
sentences.chinese: 不要说我没有人情味儿。

sentences.english: This is a darker Batman, less obviously human, more strangely other.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个更黑暗的蝙蝠侠，更少人情味，更令人陌生。

sentences.english: Yes, but a hand-picked gift just seems more personal, I suppose.
sentences.chinese: 是的，但是亲自挑选的礼物更显得有人情味。

sentences.english: Kehr is a very human person.
sentences.chinese: 凯尔是一个极富人情味的人。

sentences.english: These are the stories of the human side of Katrina.
sentences.chinese: 这是卡特里娜飓风中显现出来的人情味儿的一面。
在这里语言也显得苍白，不带人情味儿。

sentences.english: But being too cautious can make a boss seem downright heartless.
sentences.chinese: 但这样做却会让管理者看起来太没有人情味了。

sentences.english: We don't deal with large impersonal companies.
sentences.chinese: 我们不与那些没有人情味的大公司打交道。

sentences.english: Furthermore! the public's makeup taste of elegance is still far powering.
sentences.chinese: 进一步的讲，大众的风雅的审美情味还远未变成。

definition: erhua variant of 人情味[ren2 qing2 wei4]
marketplace/town/the street (urban milieu)/the haunts of the common people
variant of 淳樸|淳朴[chun2 pu3]
